intro: Listera microglottis, commonly known as the small-leaf twayblade, is a flowering plant in the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has slender, hairy stems and produces delicate, white or pale green flowers. Its leaves are small, heart-shaped, and often clustered at the base of the plant. Listera microglottis is characterized by its unique morphology and is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
